pullRequest.title: [python-experimental] Make the array items attribute optional
pullRequest.bodyText:
In OAS 3.0.x, the array "items" attribute is required.
In OAS >= 3.1, the array "items" attribute is optional such that the OAS specification is aligned with the JSON schema specification. When "items" is not specified, the elements of the array may be anything at all.

PR checklist

 Read the contribution guidelines.
 If contributing template-only or documentation-only changes which will change sample output, build the project before.
 Run the shell script(s) under ./bin/ (or Windows batch scripts under.\bin\windows) to update Petstore samples related to your fix. This is important, as CI jobs will verify all generator outputs of your HEAD commit, and these must match the expectations made by your contribution. You only need to run ./bin/{LANG}-petstore.sh, ./bin/openapi3/{LANG}-petstore.sh if updating the code or mustache templates for a language ({LANG}) (e.g. php, ruby, python, etc).
 File the PR against the correct branch: master, 4.3.x, 5.0.x. Default: master.
 Copy the technical committee to review the pull request if your PR is targeting a particular programming language.

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:CiscoM31/openapi-generator into python-array-item-is-optional

nodes.bodyText: @sebastien-rosset I don't think we need prefix and fullSuffix here. These are for models only (e.g. Pet => MyPetV3). Same for line 901.

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:CiscoM31/openapi-generator into python-array-item-is-optional

nodes.bodyText: @sebastien-rosset Shall we remove prefix, suffix from this line as well?

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:CiscoM31/openapi-generator into python-array-item-is-optional

nodes.bodyText:
We also need to include the prefix before these types and the fullSuffix after them.
Can you update it to this?
return prefix + "bool, date, datetime, dict, float, int, list, str, none_type" + fullSuffix;

Or you could include ModelUtils.isAnyTypeSchema(p) in the conditionals on lines:

906
909

And then we wouldn't need this additional if statement because we will correctly return in line 910.
Up to you which way you want to do it.

This is the 3rd location in this function that w have defined this list of all types.
Instead of defining this same info 3 times, how about doing one more recursive call and routing us to the return case on line 903 or 910? That keeps this simpler.

commit.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:CiscoM31/openapi-generator into python-array-item-is-optional
Add code comments, use recursion for any type
